item.title: US Gaming Sales Data Reveals 2025's Best-Selling Game
item.content:encoded:
Circana has released its US gaming sales data for both December and 2025 as a whole, and it turns out that a game released towards the end of the year was the best-selling title across the whole year.

As revealed by the venerable Mat Piscatella on Bluesky, EA's Battlefield 6 was 2025's best-selling game across all platforms, a feat that probably shouldn't come as a surprise given its impressive sales performance and chart dominance during its launch month.

In second place for the year is NBA 2K26, thus proving that sports games truly are evergreen, followed by Gearbox's Borderlands 4 in third place. Looks like those performance complaints didn't do the game any harm in the long run.

Continuing down the top ten, Capcom's Monster Hunter Wilds is in fourth place for 2025, which demonstrates just how strong initial sales were (even if things did start to peter out after a few months).

Fifth place goes to Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, which may be a little worryingly low for Activision and Microsoft, especially since the game's biggest rival is in the top spot.

In sixth, seventh, and eighth place are three EA sports titles, namely Madden NFL 26, EA Sports College Football 26, and EA Sports FC 26 respectively, with the final two spots in the top ten taken up by the Oblivion remaster and Black Ops 6.

Hardware-wise, it probably won't come as a surprise to learn that the Switch 2 led the year in both unit and dollar terms; it's a new piece of Nintendo kit, after all, so there was almost no chance it was going to be outperformed by two five-year-old consoles (almost being the operative word).

When it comes to December as a single month, Black Ops 7 managed to take the top spot for software, with NBA 2K26 and Battlefield 6 trailing in second and third place, respectively.

As always, it's worth reading Mat Piscatella's full thread if you want some more nerdy stats about the state of gaming sales as 2026 gets started. Stay tuned for more.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Super Mario Bros. Wonder Switch 2 Edition Release Date Revealed for March
item.content:encoded:
Nintendo has revealed that the Switch 2 Edition version of Super Mario Bros. Wonder will be arriving in March, bringing with it a number of fun new activities for you and your friends to try out.

The Switch 2 version of Super Mario Bros. Wonder was originally revealed during a Nintendo Direct back in September, and now, Nintendo has announced that the game will join its new console's lineup on March 26th as both a physical and digital release.

In a new trailer, Nintendo also goes over what you can expect if you decide to check out Super Mario Bros. Wonder on Switch 2. While some of the new features revolve around multiplayer, if you're a solo Wonder-er, you'll still have some extra challenges to enjoy.

Bellabel Park, which gives the Switch 2 Edition of Super Mario Bros. Wonder the second half of its name (Meetup in Bellabel Park), will play host to a range of new multiplayer attractions and activities, both co-op and competitive.

If that's not your speed, then you can enjoy the new Toad Brigade Training Camp, where you'll find a range of new challenges to try out across Super Mario Bros. Wonder's many courses.

You'll also find new Koopaling bosses scattered throughout some of the game's stages, and to help you take them on, Rosalina has become a playable character in the Switch 2 version of the game (and I'm sure it's no coincidence she's appearing in the upcoming Super Mario Galaxy Movie as well).

Other new features include the mouse-controlled Co-Star Luma and the new Assist Mode, which lessens some of Super Mario Bros. Wonder's challenge and makes your journey just a little less stressful.

Super Mario Bros. Wonder is available right now for Nintendo Switch, and it comes to Switch 2 on March 26th. You can check out our very own Austin's review here to find out what he thought.
